description.text: this message file contains message for [name] package

msg.text: Unable to find the DQS PIO comp for DQSBUF comp "$$s".
The width of DDR bus ($$s comp: "$$s") is $$d, which exceeds the limit of $$d. Check the design carefully.
The width of DDR group ($$s comp: "$$s") is $$d; however, this DDR group requires $$d PIO sites because it uses differential IO_TYPEs, and this exceeds the limit of $$d. Check the design carefully.
The DQSDEL input of DLLDEL comp "$$s" is driving by a non-DQSDLL comp "$$s". This is not permitted.
The CLKI input of this DLLDEL comp "$$s" is dangling. Check the design carefully.
DLLDEL comp "$$s" is driving by a non-PIO comp "$$s", which is incorrect. Check the design carefully.
PIO comp "$$s" drives more than 1 DLLDEL comps, which is not permitted. The connection between PIO and DLLDEL must be 1-to-1. Correct the design.
The ECLKI input of this ECLKSYNC comp "$$s" is dangling. Check the design carefully.
No signal is driving the CLKI input of CLKDIV comp "$$s". Correct the design.
The ECLKO output of ECLKSYNC comp "$$s" is dangling.
The connection from PLLREFCS.PLLCSOUT to PLL.CLKI.
No sites connect to site "$$s", pin "$$s".
The input of CLKFBBUF "$$s" is driven by a non-PLL type comp "$$s", which is not permitted.
The input of CLKFBBUF "$$s" is not driven by a PLL OP;, which is not permitted.
